title: co2calculatorPACTA2022
text: can install co2calculatorPACTA2022 source tarball :

title: co2calculatorPACTA2022
text: order calculate CO2 emissions building, co2calculatorPACTA2022 provides single function calculate_emissions. Please refer help("calculate_emissions") documentation regarding calculate_emissions.
code: # Load package library(co2calculatorPACTA2022) #> Package co2calculatorPACTA2022 1.2.3 loaded #> Need help? --> `vignette("co2calculatorPACTA2022")`  # Calculate the CO2 emission of a multi-family house built in 1981, without refurbishments r <- calculate_emissions(   area = 1000,   floors = 4,   year = 1981,   utilisation_key = 1,   climate_code = "KLO",   energy_carrier = "gasHeating")  # Check result str(r) #> List of 4 #>  $ heatEnergy         : num 458 #>  $ emissionCoefficient: num 0.064 #>  $ emissionsPerArea   : num 29.3 #>  $ emissionsTotal     : num 29343

title: co2calculatorPACTA2022
text: co2calculatorPACTA2022 includes three datasets. Check help pages details: climate: help("climate") utilisation: help("utilisation") constants: help("constants")

title: co2calculatorPACTA2022
text: source tarball contains complete source code data co2calculatorPACTA2022 R package.

title: Explications du script
text: Afin d’arriver au résultat final des emissions totales retournées par la fonction principale calculate_emissions(), plusieurs fonctions sont appelées. La’crchitecture de l’algorithme est présenté dans le diagramme suivant. Pour l’ouvrir en grand: function_call_diagram.svg

title: Explications du script
text: function getEmissions() implements equation. Calcul des émissions totales annuelles de CO2, sur toute la surface du batiment. emissionsTotal=area⋅emissionsPerAreaemissionsTotal = area \cdot emissionsPerArea

title: Explications du script
text: function getEmissions() implements equation. Calcul des émissions annuelles de CO2 par mètre carré, en fonction de l’énergie de chauffage requise et du coefficient d’émission du type de chauffage. emissionsPerArea=heatEnergy⋅emissionCoefficientemissionsPerArea = heatEnergy \cdot emissionCoefficient

title: Explications du script
text: function getEmissions() implements equation. Le coefficient d’émission est calculé en fonction du type de combustible utilisé et de l’année d’installation du système de chauffage. Ces donées de ghgEmissionsPerMJth et efficiencyCoefficent proviennent du dataset constants(). emissionCoefficient=ghgEmissionsPerMJthefficiencyCoefficentemissionCoefficient = \frac{ghgEmissionsPerMJth}{efficiencyCoefficent}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Total() implements equation.heatEnergy=dhwDemand+heatingDemandheatEnergy = dhwDemand + heatingDemand

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_DHW_Demand() implements equation. Ces donées proviennent directement du dataset utilisation(), en fonction du type de batiment.

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Heating_Demand() implements equation.heatingDemand=totalLosses−usedGainsheatingDemand = totalLosses - usedGains

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Losses_Total() implements equation.totalLosses=transmissionLosses+ventilationLossestotalLosses = transmissionLosses + ventilationLosses

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Losses_Transmission() implements equation. function applies formulas 76-96 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_T. Tout d’abords, pour chaque température moyenne extérieurs mensuelles, et pour chaque éléments de l’enveloppe du batiment (murs, toit, fenetres, sol), calcule la puissance des pertes par transmission, donc en watt. Ce calcul est expliqué dans la section transmissionLossesPower. Ensuite, nous pouvons transformer cette puissance en énergie, en multipliant par le nombre de secondes dans le mois. Nous divisons par 10610^6 pour obtenir le résultat en MJ, et par la surface du batiment pour obtenir le résultat par mètre carré. transmissionLosses=transmissionLossesPower⋅monthDurations106⋅areatransmissionLosses = \frac{transmissionLossesPower \cdot monthDuration_{s}}{10^6 \cdot area}

title: Explications du script
text: function calculateTransmissionLosses() implements equation. La puissance des pertes par transmission, donc en watt, est calculée pour chaque éléments de l’enveloppe du batiment (murs, toit, fenetres, sol), et pour chaque température moyenne extérieurs mensuelles. transmissionLosses=(Troom−Toutside)⋅areael⋅uValueel⋅factoreltransmissionLosses = (T_{room} - T_{outside}) \cdot area_{el} \cdot uValue_{el} \cdot factor_{el}

title: Explications du script
text: function calculateTransmissionLosses() implements equation. TroomT_{room} dépendant de la température intérieure souhaitée et d’une température additionnelle de 1°C. Aucune explications n’été trouvé pour cette température additionnelle. Celle-ci correspond peut-être à la température visée par le chauffage afin de réellement atteindre la température souhaitée. Ces valeurs sont fournis dans le dataset utilisation(). Troom=Tdesired+TadditionT_{room} = T_{desired} + T_{addition}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Losses_Ventilation() implements equation. function applies formulas 97-98 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_V. ventilationLosses=(Troom−Toutside)⋅ventilationRate⋅monthDurationh⋅ρcapacity1′000′000ventilationLosses = \frac{(T_{room} - T_{outside}) \cdot ventilationRate \cdot monthDuration_{h} \cdot \rho_{capacity}}{1'000'000}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Losses_Ventilation() implements equation. function applies formulas 97 SIA 380/1 norm. rhoCapacity represents specific heat capacity air constant pressure, adjusted altitude. value essential calculating ventilation heat losses determines much heat air can carry per unit volume per degree Celsius (Kelvin). specific heat capacity air can vary slightly temperature pressure, formula given function takes altitude consideration, presumably air density therefore heat capacity change altitude. following formula calculates specific heat capacity air joules per cubic meter per Kelvin (J/(m³·K)), adjusting altitude building location meters. sea level, specific heat capacity air approximately 1220 J/(m³·K), decreases slightly increasing altitude due decrease air pressure density. ρcapacity=1220−(0.14⋅altitude)\rho_{capacity} = 1220 - (0.14 \cdot altitude)

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Used() implements equation. function applies formulas 115 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_ug. usedGains=totalGains⋅utilisationusedGains = totalGains \cdot utilisation

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Total() implements equation. function applies formula 110 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_g. totalGains=electricGains⋅bodyGains⋅solarGainstotalGains = electricGains \cdot bodyGains \cdot solarGains

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Electricity() implements equation. function applies formula 101 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_iEl. electricGains=electricityUse⋅electricityUseFactorelectricGains = electricityUse \cdot electricityUseFactor Note: electricityUse electricityUseFactor set constants utilisation() dataset.

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_BodyHeat() implements equation. function applies formula 102 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_iP. bodyGains=personHeat⋅personPresence⋅3′600personArea⋅1′000′000bodyGains = \frac{personHeat \cdot personPresence \cdot 3'600}{personArea \cdot 1'000'000}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Solar() implements equation. function applies formula 104 109 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_sX Q_s. solarGains=∑el=1nmonthlyIrradiationSum(orientationel)⋅0.9⋅areael⋅opacityel⋅frameFactorel⋅shadingFactorelareasolarGains = \frac{\sum_{el=1}^{n} monthlyIrradiationSum(orientation_{el}) \cdot 0.9 \cdot area_{el} \cdot opacity_{el} \cdot frameFactor_{el} \cdot shadingFactor_{el}}{area}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Used() implements equations. function applies formula 114 SIA 380/1 norm. utilisation variable represents efficiency building can utilize available heat gains offset heating demand. analysis need done understand equation utilisation. utilisation=1−ratioutilisationParam1−ratioutilisationParam+1utilisation = \frac{1-ratio^{utilisationParam}}{1-ratio^{utilisationParam + 1}}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Used() implements equations. function applies formula 111 SIA 380/1 norm. ratio total heat gains (totalgains) total heat losses (totallosses) month. reflects much heat gains can potentially offset heat losses. ratio=totalGainstotalLossesratio = \frac{totalGains}{totalLosses}

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Used() implements equations. function applies formula 113 SIA 380/1 norm. utilisationParam calculated parameter represents efficiency building can utilize available internal external heat gains (sunlight, occupants, appliances, etc.) offset heating requirements. utilisationParam=heatgainsFactor+(timeConst/heatgainsTime)utilisationParam = heatgainsFactor + (timeConst / heatgainsTime) Note: heatgainsFactor heatgainsTime set constants utilisation() dataset.

title: Explications du script
text: function Q_Gains_Used() implements equation. function applies formulas 112 SIA 380/1 norm. timeconst represents time constant building, measure quickly building responds changes external temperature. time constant gives indication time takes building react temperature differences, affecting heat gains utilized time. resulting timeconst hours, reflecting long takes building equilibrate new steady-state temperature change heat gains losses. larger timeconst indicates building high thermal mass reacts slowly temperature changes. Note: heatcapacity set constant 0.3Jm2⋅°C0.3 \frac{J}{m^2 \cdot °C}. timeConst=heatCapacity⋅area⋅1′000′000heatTransferCoefficient⋅3′600timeConst = \frac{heatCapacity \cdot area \cdot 1'000'000}{heatTransferCoefficient \cdot 3'600}

title: Explications du script
text: function Heat_Transfer_Coefficient() implements equations. function applies formula 100 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible H. heatTransferCoefficient=opaqueElementsTransfer+ventilationTransferheatTransferCoefficient = opaqueElementsTransfer + ventilationTransferopaqueElementsTransfer=∑el=1nuValueel⋅areael⋅factorelopaqueElementsTransfer = \sum_{el=1}^{n} uValue_{el} \cdot area_{el} \cdot factor_{el}ventilationTransfer=ρcapacity⋅ventilationRate⋅area3600ventilationTransfer = \frac{\rho_{capacity} \cdot ventilationRate \cdot area}{3600}

text: Wider T, Zumwald M, Sandoval D (2024). co2calculatorPACTA2022: Calculate building CO2 emissions (PACTA 2022 version). R package version 1.2.3, https://github.com/maximecharriere/co2calculatorPACTA2022, https://maximecharriere.github.io/co2calculatorPACTA2022/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {co2calculatorPACTA2022: Calculate building CO2 emissions (PACTA 2022 version)},   author = {Thomas Wider and Marius Zumwald and Diego Sandoval},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.3, https://github.com/maximecharriere/co2calculatorPACTA2022},   url = {https://maximecharriere.github.io/co2calculatorPACTA2022/}, }

title: Calculate building CO2 emissions (PACTA 2022 version)
text: co2calculatorPACTA2022 R package provides functionality calculate carbon dioxide (CO2) emission building. calculation based norm SIA 380/1:2009 “Thermische Energie im Hochbau”. Ce site sert d’explication sur l’utilisation et le fonctionnement du script R développé par WüestPartner. Ce site comporte les pages suivantes: Get started : Permet d’apprendre à installer et utiliser la fonction calculate_emissions(). Explainations : Explique l’architecture et les fonctions du script. Reference : Rentre en détail sur la définition et fonctionement des différentes fonctions du script. Authors : Présente les noms et contacts des auteurs du script.

what: Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
title: Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
text: calculateTransmissionLosses computes heat transmission losses opaque window elements building given outside temperature building parameters. function calculates losses element watts, taking account difference room temperature (adjusted specific utilisation) outside temperature, area element, U-value, optional factor adjusts loss calculation.

title: Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
text: outsideTemp Numeric, outside temperature degrees Celsius. params list returned get_parameters function. list must include utilisation, opaqueElements, windowElements, : utilisation database information specific building utilisation. opaqueElements list opaque building elements (e.g., walls, roof, floor). windowElements list window elements.

title: Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
text: list elements, element list containing: name name building element. losses Calculated heat transmission losses element watts.

title: Calculate Transmission Losses for Building Elements — calculateTransmissionLosses
text: function provides detailed breakdown transmission losses, useful thermal analysis buildings. differentiates opaque window elements, allowing comprehensive assessment building's thermal envelope.

title: Calculate CO2 emissions — calculate_emissions
text: calculate_emissions calculates CO2 emissions building according input arguments described .

title: Calculate CO2 emissions — calculate_emissions
code: calculate_emissions(   area,   floors,   year,   utilisation_key,   climate_code,   energy_carrier,   walls_refurb_year = NULL,   roof_refurb_year = NULL,   windows_refurb_year = NULL,   floor_refurb_year = NULL,   heating_install_year = NULL )

title: Calculate CO2 emissions — calculate_emissions
text: area Mandatory, numeric. Area (square meters) heating cooling required ("Energiebezugsfläche"). e.g. 1000 floors Mandatory, numeric. Number floors within building envelope ("thermische Gebäudehülle"). e.g. 4 year Mandatory, numeric. Year building construction. e.g. 1981 utilisation_key Mandatory, numeric. Main utilisation building according SIA 380/1:2009. following utilisations possible: Check full dataset using utilisation. climate_code Mandatory, string. Abbreviation code assigned climate station according "Auszug aus Merkblatt SIA 2028:2015". following climate stations available: ABO: Adelboden AIG: Aigle ALT: Altdorf BAS: Basel-Binningen BER: Bern-Liebefeld BUS: Buchs-Aarau CDF: La Chaux-de-Fonds CHU: Chur DAV: Davos DIS: Disentis ENG: Engelberg FRE: La Frétaz GLA: Glarus GSB: Grand-St-Bernard GUT: Güttingen GVE: Genève-Cointrin INT: Interlaken KLO: Zürich-Kloten LUG: Lugano LUZ: Luzern MAG: Magadino MVE: Montana NEU: Neuchâtel OTL: Locarno-Monti PAY: Payerne PIO: Piotta PUY: Pully ROB: Robbia RUE: Rünenberg SAM: Samedan SBE: San Bernardino SCU: Scuol SHA: Schaffhausen SIO: Sion SMA: Zürich-MeteoSchweiz STG: St. Gallen ULR: Ulrichen VAD: Vaduz WYN: Wynau ZER: Zermatt Check full dataset using climate. energy_carrier Mandatory, string. Energy carrier used heating domestic hot water production. following energy carriers available: oilHeating gasHeating undefined walls_refurb_year Optional, numeric, default value NULL. Year wall refurbishment. e.g. 2010 Supply NULL NA refurbishment taken place since year building construction. roof_refurb_year Optional, numeric, default value NULL. Year roof refurbishment. e.g. 2010 Supply NULL NA refurbishment taken place since year building construction. windows_refurb_year Optional, numeric, default value NULL. Year window refurbishment. e.g. 2010 Supply NULL NA refurbishment taken place since year building construction. floor_refurb_year Optional, numeric, default value NULL. Year basement floor refurbishment. e.g. 2010 Supply NULL NA refurbishment taken place since year building construction. heating_install_year Optional, numeric, default value NULL. Year heating installation. e.g. 2010 Supply NULL NA heating replacement taken place since year building construction.

title: Calculate CO2 emissions — calculate_emissions
text: calculate_emissions returns list r containing calculation results: r$heatEnergy: annual heat energy required per area, MJ/m2 per year r$emissionCoefficient: applied CO2 emission coefficient according given energy carrier, kg/MJ r$emissionsPerArea: annual CO2 emissions per area, kg/m2 per year r$emissionsTotal: total annual CO2 emissions, kg per year

title: Calculate CO2 emissions — calculate_emissions
code: # Example 1: # calculate CO2 emissions of a multi-family house built in 1981, without refurbishments ex1 <- calculate_emissions(   area = 1000,   floors = 4,   year = 1981,   utilisation_key = 1,   climate_code = "KLO",   energy_carrier = "gasHeating" ) str(ex1) #> List of 4 #>  $ heatEnergy         : num 458 #>  $ emissionCoefficient: num 0.064 #>  $ emissionsPerArea   : num 29.3 #>  $ emissionsTotal     : num 29343  # Example 2: # same building as above but with additional refurbishments (roof & walls) in 2010 ex2 <- calculate_emissions(   area = 1000,   floors = 4,   year = 1981,   utilisation_key = 1,   climate_code = "KLO",   energy_carrier = "gasHeating",   walls_refurb_year = 2010,   roof_refurb_year = 2010,   heating_install_year = 2010 ) str(ex2) #> List of 4 #>  $ heatEnergy         : num 302 #>  $ emissionCoefficient: num 0.0599 #>  $ emissionsPerArea   : num 18.1 #>  $ emissionsTotal     : num 18107

what: Calculate GHG Emissions from Energy Use — getEmissions
title: Calculate GHG Emissions from Energy Use — getEmissions
text: getEmissions calculates greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions associated energy use building, taking account energy carrier, heating efficiency, total heat energy required. function considers efficiency heating systems installed different periods adjusts emission coefficient accordingly. calculation based total energy demand estimated Q_Total_Sum function applies conversion factors translate energy use GHG emissions.

Calculate GHG Emissions from Energy Use — getEmissions

what: Calculate Building's Heat Transfer Coefficient — Heat_Transfer_Coefficient
title: Calculate Building's Heat Transfer Coefficient — Heat_Transfer_Coefficient
text: function applies formula 100 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible H.Heat_Transfer_Coefficient computes overall heat transfer coefficient building. coefficient measure building's ability transfer heat envelope, including opaque elements (walls, roof, floor) effect ventilation. calculation takes account U-values building elements, areas, adjustment factors, well impact ventilation based building's volume specific heat capacity air building's altitude.

title: Calculate Building's Heat Transfer Coefficient — Heat_Transfer_Coefficient
Calculate Building's Heat Transfer Coefficient — Heat_Transfer_Coefficient
text: params list returned get_parameters function.

title: Calculate Building's Heat Transfer Coefficient — Heat_Transfer_Coefficient
text: Numeric. overall heat transfer coefficient building, expressed Watts per degree Celsius (W/°C). value provides comprehensive measure building's thermal transmittance, incorporating conduction envelope convection via ventilation.

what: Calculate Monthly DHW Energy Demand per Square Meter — Q_DHW_Demand
title: Calculate Monthly DHW Energy Demand per Square Meter — Q_DHW_Demand
text: Q_DHW_Demand estimates monthly energy required Domestic Hot Water (DHW) per square meter building. function calculates demand based daily DHW demand specific building type.

title: Calculate Monthly DHW Energy Demand per Square Meter — Q_DHW_Demand
Calculate Monthly DHW Energy Demand per Square Meter — Q_DHW_Demand
text: params list returned get_parameters function.

title: Calculate Monthly DHW Energy Demand per Square Meter — Q_DHW_Demand
text: numeric vector length 12, representing monthly energy demand DHW per square meter, measured megajoules (MJ). element vector corresponds one month year.

what: Calculate Monthly Body Heat Gains — Q_Gains_BodyHeat
title: Calculate Monthly Body Heat Gains — Q_Gains_BodyHeat
text: function applies formula 102 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_iP.Q_Gains_BodyHeat estimates monthly heat gains attributed occupants within building, expressed megajoules per square meter (MJ/m²). function calculates heat generated human body, considering time spent person building, heat emission rate, occupied area.

title: Calculate Monthly Body Heat Gains — Q_Gains_BodyHeat

text: params list returned get_parameters function.

text: params list returned get_parameters function.

what: Calculate Monthly Solar Heat Gains — Q_Gains_Solar
title: Calculate Monthly Solar Heat Gains — Q_Gains_Solar
text: function applies formula 104 109 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_sX Q_s. Q_Gains_Solar estimates solar heat gains windows month, expressed megajoules per square meter (MJ/m²). calculates solar gains considering orientation, area, specific properties window element, along monthly solar irradiation. calculation accounts factors window's opacity, frame factor, shading factor, normalizing gains building's area.

title: Calculate Monthly Heating Energy Demand — Q_Heating_Demand

what: Calculate Total Monthly Heat Losses — Q_Losses_Total
title: Calculate Total Monthly Heat Losses — Q_Losses_Total
text: function applies formula 99 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_ot. Q_Losses_Total calculates total monthly heat losses per square meter building. function combines heat losses due transmission (Q_Losses_Transmission) ventilation (Q_Losses_Ventilation), providing comprehensive view building's overall heat loss. calculation reflects sum two components, giving estimate total energy loss building envelope due air exchange.

title: Calculate Total Monthly Heat Losses — Q_Losses_Total
Calculate Total Monthly Heat Losses — Q_Losses_Total
text: params list returned get_parameters function.

title: Calculate Total Monthly Heat Losses — Q_Losses_Total
text: numeric vector length 12, representing total heat losses month, measured megajoules (MJ) per square meter. element corresponds one month year, illustrating seasonal fluctuation heat losses.

what: Calculate Monthly Transmission Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Transmission
title: Calculate Monthly Transmission Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Transmission
text: function applies formulas 76-96 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_T. Q_Losses_Transmission calculates heat transmission losses building envelope month, converting results megajoules per square meter (MJ/m2). assess losses based varying outside temperatures throughout year. utilizes calculateTransmissionLosses function compute losses building element (opaque window elements), aggregates losses provide monthly total.

title: Calculate Monthly Transmission Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Transmission
Calculate Monthly Transmission Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Transmission
text: params list returned get_parameters function.

title: Calculate Monthly Transmission Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Transmission
text: numeric vector length 12, representing total transmission heat losses month, expressed MJ/m2. Negative loss values set 0 ensure output values represent actual heat losses.

what: Calculate Monthly Ventilation Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Ventilation
title: Calculate Monthly Ventilation Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Ventilation
text: function applies formulas 97-98 SIA 380/1 norm, aligns varaible Q_V. Q_Losses_Ventilation calculates heat losses due ventilation month, expressed megajoules per square meter (MJ/m2). takes account difference indoor outdoor temperatures, building's ventilation rate, specific heat capacity air given altitude.

title: Calculate Monthly Ventilation Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Ventilation
Calculate Monthly Ventilation Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Ventilation
text: params list returned get_parameters function.

title: Calculate Monthly Ventilation Heat Losses in MJ/m2 — Q_Losses_Ventilation
text: numeric vector length 12, representing ventilation heat losses month, expressed MJ/m2. Negative loss values automatically set 0 ensure output values represent actual heat losses.

text: Q_Total computes total monthly heat demand building, combining heating demand space heating domestic hot water (DHW) demand.
